availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, pastor. Franklin County, Georgia, native. Ordained in 1825. Active in Georgia and South Carolina from 1825 to 1829. Pastor of the First Baptist Church in Louisville, Kentucky, from 1829 to 1839, for the African American membership. Pastor at the First African Baptist Church, subsequently known as the Fifth Street Baptist Church, in Louisville from 1839 to 1872.

ab.bibl: Cornelius Bogert, "Adams, Henry" in John A. Hardin, Karen Cotton McDaniel and Gerald Smith, eds., The Kentucky African American Encyclopedia (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2015), 1. Marion B. Lucas, A History of Blacks in Kentucky: From Slavery to Segregation, 1760-1891 (Frankfort: The Kentucky Historical Society, 1992), 123-126.
